snippet: At a rally Saturday, Mitt Romney did not just recite the Pledge of Allegiance; he metaphorically wrapped his stump speech in it, using each line of the pledge to attack President Obama.
abstract: Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney, appearing at a Virginia Beach rally, metaphorically wraps his stump speech in the Pledge of Allegiance, using each line of the pledge to attack the Obama presidency and its policies.
lead_paragraph: At a rally Saturday, Mitt Romney did not just recite the Pledge of Allegiance; he metaphorically wrapped his stump speech in it, using each line of the pledge to attack President Obama.

headline.seo: Romney Uses Pledge of Allegiance to Criticize Obama
headline.main: In Romney’s Hands, Pledge of Allegiance Is Framework for Criticism
